narrative.title: 4Th Indian Division - 1942Q2
narrative.situation: British Indian Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1942Q2.
narrative.objectives: Division NOT operational as cohesive unit during 1942-Q2. Brigades dispersed to separate theaters for garrison/training duties. GOC Tuker strongly opposed dispersal. 11th Brigade saw combat at Tobruk (captured). 5th Brigade rushed to First Alamein July 1942. Division not reunited until October 1942.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Multiple theaters: Cyprus (mountainous coast), Syria (desert/mountains), Egypt (coastal desert - Suez/Mersa Matruh), Libya (coastal desert - Tobruk)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Mountain warfare expertise (utilized later in Italy)
Experienced in desert warfare from Operation Compass 1940-41
